The graphics are amazing. Textures are really high-quality, particles are great, and the level design is beyond awesome.

The humor is original, witty, and is delivered at the exact right times.

It does lack advanced graphics settings though, and the default controls (remappable) are a bit awkward.

Overall, 9/10. A must-buy!

10698593.review:
Think God of War but with a black guy, a floating Mayan mask that talks, an evil asian man, and a girl. 

Also the set pieces and environment are beautifully illuminated by a bright orange sunlight. 

Gameplay: God of War but with a black guy and a witty sacred Mayan mask.

Dialogue: It doesn't suck and I actually enjoy it. The interactions between Marlow and the Mask are pretty human-like and the mask isn't like some stuck-up boring character. The mask is chill as fuck, bro-tier and sometimes compliments or insults Marlow playfully. 

Here's a good example: 
Mask: "Ek Chuah Ix. This is your name as the sacred warrior reborn! Or Chu-Chu for short." 

Briggs: "Do NOT call me Chu-Chu.."

Mask: "As you wish...Chu-Chu..."

Marlow Briggs himself: Actually a pretty relatable character. Although he has new abilities, he's still human and reacts to things very human-like. Instead of being some edgy guy, he reacts to situations how normal people would react. For example here is one of his quotes: "Who designed this?!" 

Setting: Beautifully illuminated and just looks pretty in general. Everything is bright and eyecandy-like. 

Combos: Pretty much handle like God of War

Overall: I'd recommend it to any action game/hack 'n slash fan. 

Also if you like explosions, you'll like this game.

Mis à part cela, le jeu n'est pas casse-tête pour un sous. On est pris par la main de bout en bout (fini les moments où on ne sait plus où aller). Cela peut être un avantage comme un inconvénient. Reste que le jeu est un bon défouloir. Pour 0.99 € (soldes Steam), aucune raison de bouder son plaisir !

10572640.review:
It's not often that you'll come across a game as odd as Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death. It's a budget title from ZootFly, famous for their Ghostbusters demo they released a few years before the actual game from Atari.  On paper, its a generic action game. You play Marlow Briggs, you work on a rig?..., bad guys come after you, you get infused with the power of the jungle, now you can fight the bad guys. 

But Marlow Briggs, to experience Marlow Briggs, is entirely different thing all together.

 Imagine, almost to a fault, a Sony all-stars mashup. Imagine the world of Nathan Drake's Uncharted, invaded by a mildly pissed off Kratos, who is guided along his journey by the “Aku-Aku” mask from Crash Bandicoot, roll them together like a Katamari Damacy ball and you have Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death.

  This game, is for lack of a better definition a B-Game. It's story doesn't rival any of the before mentioned games, and it isn't trying to. Marlow is a clever mix, cherry picked from the finest parts of other games, and created it's own awe inspiring game.  It's fun, the action is constant and enjoyable. The story is simple, but the characters are interesting. Marlow is a tough, but soft hero, imagine a Keith David meets Sidney Poitier. He's a character who can be kind, but shake some sass if he has to. He's followed by the Mask of Death, who like the Aku-Aku mask follows the player around, providing the comic relief and instructional help.

  The action is non stop. It just keeps blasting right around you. The gameplay is almost exactly like God of War or DMC, hack and slash, mowing down enemys left and right. 

  For $5.00, or if you've purchased it during the summer sale for $0.99, Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death is a fantastic game. It has the polish and action of a AAA title, not a budget title, and could serve as the perfect black sheep to the family of Sony games that inspired it's creation. 

A must buy.

This game is the true cinematic experience that so called 'AAA' games claim to offer. While having a typical God of War-like combat system (not like these AAA games try to be original with their gameplay/combat), i offsets it by having some cool looking weapons and attacks. To top it off Marlow is a lovable hero unlike that moronic man-child Kratos, and to top it off he's the kind of diverse ethincy video character that AAA games sadly shy away from.
In addition, despite being a low budget game, the developers did an EXCELLENT job with some of the scenery and set pieces (check my online album of the game on Steam for some examples).

The game's plot is simple:
Lo Pan kidnaps Marlow's woman and leaves him for dead by having an ancient scythe weapon lodged onto Marlow's chest. Unbeknownst to Lo Pan, the scythe then resurrects Marlow with the help of an ancient Incan (or Mayan, I forget) King, shown in this game as being a disembodied skull voiced by Steve Blum.

As Marlow travels to save his love, he gains more weapons and abilities to waste Lo Pan's army and the nightmarish oversized insects and phantoms that get in his way.

I'd recommend playing on Easy, because enemies tend to take a lot of hits before they die on Normal.

Hack and Slash is pretty much my favourite game genre. The plot is simple but neat, and the villian is pretty wonderfully awful. I like the protagonist and enjoy playing him, and the combat is great fun and satisfying.

But I found the game mechanics and terrain a little weird - I would end up stuck because of weird jump puzzles that required expert timing and control to get past. I got the feeling those parts were not meant to be confusing, just badly thought out. It just became frustrating. The controls and camera angle changes reminded me of "Landstalker," and could be confusing during parts of the game that required careful control or even just pushing objects around.

Overall it's a good game but I would prefer the challenge come from harder enemies or outright proper puzzles than just confusing terrain. I spent more time timing jumps than actually fighting, so it felt like more of a puzzle game than a hack and slash.

I played a few hours but I don't think I'll ever finish it. If you like jumping puzzles and sometimes fighting you will dig this, otherwise give it a miss.

10372205.review:
Marlow Briggs versetzt dich in die Rolle von Marlow der seine Freundin bei ihrer Arbeit auf einer Ausgrabungsstätte besucht. Schnell stellt sich jedoch heraus, dass es sich bei dem Auftraggeber der Ausgrabungen um einen skrupellosen reichen Kriminellen handelt. Marlow möchte mit seiner Freundin die Stätte verlassen, aber das geht ordentlich schief und das Geschehen nimmt seinen Lauf.

Die klischeehafte Handlung kann man getrost verschmerzen, denn das Hauptaugenmerk liegt bei Marlow Briggs ganz deutlich auf der Action. Action gibt es reichlich in Form von wilden Prügeleien inklusive Kombo-System mit verschiedenen Waffen wie z.B. einer Sense oder oder einer Peitsche. Diese lassen sich im Verlaufe des Spiels finden und aufwerten - wobei hier auch gleichzeitig Marlows Gesundheit und Magieleiste mit wächst. Bei gefüllter Magieleiste lassen sich gegen Ende des Spiels insgesamt 4 verschiedene mächtige Zauber wirken die dem Spieler mehr als nur einmal den Hintern retten können.

Denn das Spiel kann einen in diversen Situationen ganz schön ins Schwitzen bringen. Die Gegner stecken zunehmend mehr ein und teilen zusätzlich auch noch mehr aus. Ohne den gezielten Einsatz von Kombos und Magie ist ein Scheitern an bestimmten Gegnertypen oftmals vorprogrammiert. Gerade dann, wenn dann wenn man auch noch auf Fallen in der Umgebung achten muss. Glücklicherweise wird bei einem Ableben des Charakters die Zeit zurück gedreht und man kann es erneut versuchen - ganz ohne Bestrafungen.

Neben den Prügeleien gibt es massig Abwechslung in Form von kleineren Puzzels und verschiedenen Minispielen wie z.B. Arcade-Flugzeugspielchen oder mehreren Frogger-Klonen. Witzig kommentiert wird das ganze immer wieder von den Hauptcharakteren, die offenbar stellenweise das ganze Geschehen nicht besonders ernst nehmen.

Ernst ist das Spiel nämlich nicht, sondern zieht unaufdringlich das ganze Action-Genre gehörig durch den Kakao. Anspielungen auf zahlreiche Klischees (z.B. wenn mal wieder "rein zufällig" ein hilfreicher Gegenstand mitten in der Gegend rumliegt) findet man an jeder Ecke.

Die Steuerung geht flüssig von der Hand, die Geräuscheffekte und die Musik untermalen das Geschehen atmosphärisch und stimming. Die Grafik ist sehr schön und besticht durch detailierte Landschaften. Alleine die Charaktermodels hätten hin und wieder einige Polygone mehr vertragen können. Die Hände von Marlow sind z.B. auffällig kantig geraten.

Das Spiel konnte ich auf der Schwierigkeitsstufe "Schwer" innerhalb von 9 Stunden durchspielen. Wiederspielwert hat Marlow Briggs aufgrund der sehr linearen Level und der Tatsache, dass man sämtliche Verbesserung innerhalb eines Durchlaufs freispielen kann leider nur wenig.

Beim Durchspielen bin ich auf 2 technische Schwierigkeiten gestoßen:

1) In einem Level das in Ruinen spielt kam es zu sehr vielen sporadischen Abstürzen des Spiels. Ich musste meinen PC mehrfach neustarten um das Level zu durchqueren. Alle anderen Level ließen sich jedoch ohne Probleme spielen.

2) Das automatische Speichern des Spiels legte teilweise in sehr ungünstigen Situationen einen Speicherpunkt an. So wurde mehrfach gespeichert wenn mein Charakter gerade über sehr wenig Leben verfügte und beim Sterben bin ich dann erneut mit sehr wenig Leben gestartet. Wenn man mit sehr wenig Leben vor einem Boss steht segnet man teils zwangsläufig das Zeitliche und das Spiel kann nicht fortgesetzt werden. Abhilfe lieferte hier das Laden des Spielstands von davor.

Bei einem Preis von nur 4,99€ kann ich jedoch über die wenigen technischen Mängel hinwegsehen und empfehle Marlow Briggs aufgrund der sehr gelungenen Atmosphäre, dem Spielwitz und der insgesamt sehr unterhaltsamen 9 Spielstunden.

Ok lets start by saying this is no "GOD OF WAR",has the same sort of gameplay and even the same style of weapons and abilities,BUT and i say BUT thats where it stops (dont think that KRATOS swears as much as MARLOW).To be honest the idea of the mask bringing MARLOW back to life reminds me of the same thing that happened in the latest incarnation of the SPLATTER HOUSE franchise.
So why would you play this game if you have played those,well simple really even though the game hase'nt had as much money thrown at it-it is still a really solid game and deserves your time if you like this sort of game.
The graphics look nice,the voice overs are good (sure the main bad guy is voiced by LO PAN from big trouble in little china) and the music in game also does its job perfectly.
The game plays out like a B movie classic and thats a good thing,many a time you will hear a one liner come out of MARLOWS mouth and plenty of times you will laugh at the in game jokes.
The mask is the best character in game and between it and MARLOW they form a good partnership and come the end of the game its like you were watching a sort of twilight zone twisted version of LETHAL WEAPON.
I will say that this is another game with not much replay value,do everything in game and power up completely and you wont feel short changed (bar a few mistakes and tough challenges the whole amount of time i have garnered on this game was actually playing time).
I would reccomend this game and just hope that the "ITS NOT GOD OF WAR IS IT" doesnt put of to many people,as that ending just needs an explanation and a continuation,so come on KRATOS move over as MARLOW BRIGGS WANTS YOUR HEAD MAN.

10085795.review:
Initially a fun little God-of-War style brawler, with nice visuals and a decent line in over-the-top 80s action movie flavour. Even some of the canned wisecracks were sort of funny.
About two thirds of the way in, however, the difficulty spikes and the fights become a real chore - you're constantly dodging out of the way and never get to use any of the neat combos the game has spent the past few hours teaching you. Some of the jumping sections are also pretty obnoxious, with checkpoints set way too far back. The camera is not manually controllable, and whilst it usually does a decent job of being in the right place can be annoying when you just want to look around and work out a puzzle or plan a jump. There is a manual save function which can mitigate some of the frustration if you notice and remember to use it.

Whilst the game certainly has its good points - the art is pretty cool, and the fights are fun at first - I found it too frustrating and with too many cheap-feeling deaths to get a recommendation. If you have a slightly masochistic streak and don't mind trying the same jump over and over, maybe this would suit you.

9993474.review:
So here's the deal: Marlow Briggs is just an average dude, visiting his girlfriend Eva somewhere in the jungle of South America, working for an old chinese man, translating mayan artefacts. Unfortunately Marlow gets killed with an ancient weapon and his girlfriend is kidnapped. Instead of dying, Marlow gets infused with an ancient power, becoming the sacred warrior, whose prophecy it is to protect the the old artefacts. His only aim is to rescue his girlfriend and stopping the old chinese of destroying the world. Xibalba can wait. Under the guidance of his new buddy, a flying mask, he starts to fight everything the jungle and militia have to offer - or he is just making some damn silly jokes. The gameplay isn't special. It's a God of War/Devil May Cry clone, but the copy works flawless and is entertaining and challenging. The optics are nice and the soundtrack is very good. All in all a very solid game for a low price.

Bonus: the most creative use of endgame credits. People with long names suck!

I've been totally unimpressed by Uncharted and God of War, but this game's phenomenal.

9918694.review:
Бюджетный God Of War в современном сеттинге.

С самого начала игры, нас кидают в самый центр боевых действий. Начав играть, вы будете удивлены так же как и я, здесь каждые 5 минут что то взрывается, падают здания, мрут десятки врагов и все в том же духе. Игра не дает заскучать ни на минуту, ведь здесь всегда что то происходит на экране и некоторые сцены напоминают многомиллионные голливудские боевики. Почему я сравнил её с God Of War? Все очень просто - это практически одинаковые игры по механике, только в разных временных рамках и отличающиеся бюджетом. Вообщем мне игра очень понравилась и не буду затягивать, перейду сразу к плюсам и минусам, а так же подведу итог:
1. 
-Отличная боевая система с разнообразным оружием и индивидуальным стилем боя для каждого из них (+)
-Очень скудная прокачка этого самого оружия и спец способностей. На мой взгляд следовало либо все доработать, либо вообще отказаться от нее (-)
2.
-Разнообразие врагов порадовало, хоть и выглядят они как армии клонов :) (+)
-Глуповатое поведение противников иногда поражает... Хотя чего еще ожидать от игры такого плана) (-)
3.
-В действии картинка в игре смотрится великолепно, все взрывается, водичка колышется, тени от деревьев, заснеженные пейзажи и т.д. (+)
-Но стоит остановить и приглядеться поближе, то сразу бросаются в глаза кучи мелочей, которые очень портят впечатления от графики в игре (-)
4.
-Разнообразные мини игры неплохо разбавляют игровой процесс. Например нам дадут управлять вертолетом в стиле аркадных стрелялок из 90х (+)
-Сюжет не завезли (-)

В итоге получился вполне годный продукт, проходящийся за 7-9 часов в спокойном темпе. Чувствуется что разработчики были очень ограничены в денежном плане, но даже это не помешало им выпустить очень достойную игру. Ну и переходим к оценкам:

Геймплей: 8/10
Графон: 6/10
Сюжет: 5/10
Музыка: 7/10
Моя итоговая оценка: 7/10 (Стоит поиграть)

9805469.review:
[h1] Как нужно делать слэшеры [/h1]
Никогда не считал слэшеры чем-то интересным, Но Marlow Briggs заставила меня взглянуть на этот жанр иначе. Честно говоря я никогда не слышал об этой игре ранее и просто купил её на распродаже, заинтересовавшись скриншотами. Вот сумбурное описание всех плюсов и минусов этой игры:
 [b] Сюжет [/b] - никто не ждёт от сюжета в слэшере чего-то экстраординарного. В этой игре сюжет простой, можно сказать классический. Подружку главного героя похищают и наш герой должен её спасти, орудуя [i] МАГИЧЕСКИМ ОРУЖИЕМ [/i] и собственными умениями.
[b] Геймплей [/b] - лучшая сторона этой игры. Он стремительно меняется каждые две минуты. Слэшер, файтинг, beat em up, платформер, аркадная леталка, тир и многое другое ждёт вас в этой игре. Скучать она не даёт за счёт своего разнообразия и невысокой сложности. Часто возникало ощущение, что я играю в игру на игровом автомате, где всё сделно так, чтобы я не хотел прекращать играть и кинул ещё одну монетку.
[b] Графика[/b] - хоть её и нельзя назвать выдающейся, но нужно отдать должное геймдизайнерам: из графического движка они выжали всё, что возможно, плюс очень постарались сделать картинку сочной, такой, что раз в 10 минут возникает желпание сделать скриншот.
[b] Звук и музыка[/b] - присутствуют и ничем особенным не выделяются.
[b] Недостатки [/b] - иногда возникают баги, заставляющие нашего персонажа провалиться сквозь землю. Неравномерная сложность игры. Играя на самом высоком уровне сложности можно в течение часа удивляться какая же это лёгкая игра, а потом застрять где-нибудь минут на 20. Иногда управление бывает не очень логичным, вообще рекоменду играть с геймпадом - и нервы будут целы и больше удовольствия получите. Наверно это все недостатки, что я заметил. 

Если вы любите олдскульные бит эм апы и слэшеры, то игру я рекомендую категорически. Она стоит своих денег и пары-тройки  проведённых за ней вечеров.

If Planet Terror is your go-to-B-Movie to watch, the Marlow Briggs is your go-to-videogame that you dust off on a rainy day, put on the Mask of Death, and leap into a hundred enemies while trying to save your girlfriend.

One reviewer quote said it all: Marlow Briggs is truly impossible to dislike and delivers 6-7 hours of solid fun.

Sure, the production values are low, but the B-movie feel, the fun minigames, the nice set pieces, and the dialogues between the Mask and Marlow make it an enjoyable ride that I recommend to everyone.

9750889.review:
If Marlow Briggs isn't Lara Croft's long lost brother, he ought to be: straight out of a B-movie, he is shimmying and shooting his way around anarcheological dig in a most manly way, mutilating machinery and munching mana, aided by a jungle god who has nominated Briggs to be hero of the hour.

If you get this game, you'll be getting an interactive B-movie done well: gameplay is linear, with a mixture of tried-and-true platforming and streetfighting, the writing's tolerable as long as you don't expect much in the way of a plot, and the level design is as gorgeous as the screenshots suggest.

You could do worse than pick this up in the bargain bin.

9731952.review:
[b]Pros[/b]
This game is silly...and it embraces it! The cut scenes are almost a parody on typical Hollywood action movies, and their style is unique and beautiful (although after a while, it may become tedious to some, but you skip them). You've got an intesting 'companion' which constantly is either making fun of you, guiding you, or cheering depending on the situation.
If you're into silly humor and action-adventure hack&slash games, you'll totally love this game! It has some great puzzle sections which require some thought, but not too hard to make you get stuck. 
You start with one weapon, but every hour or so you either get a new weapon or a new magic skill, which broadens your arsenal and keeps the combat fresh. Each weapon is the most efficient against a certain type of enemy, and that makes the combat interesting.
The game has a really nice checkpoint system, so that if you die, you almost never have to complete a whole section again. This fixed a frustration that I have with many games nowadays that use a checkpoint system. You also have the option to save manually.

[b]Cons[/b]
I would've liked some more enemy variety for regular mobs though. While the boss monsters are quite nice and unique, the same regular enemies keep coming back during the game (but to their credit, they sometimes add a new variety to the insect/human mix).

[b]Conclusion[/b]
I've clocked in at around 8 hours to complete this game, which was perfect. It provides constant action and it pushes you forward because of it.I was constantly looking forward to the next encounter, weapon upgrade or silly jokes.
I picked this game up during the sale, but knowing what I know now, I would've even bought it outside of a sale.

9700762.review:
What good things can I say about this game that haven't already been said in other reviews?

First things first. This is a great hack and slash in the same style as God of War, but in an action movie motif that screams 'Big Trouble in Little China' homage. Much like the 80s film, the hero (who may be the sidekick depending on opinion) is thrust into saving his girlfriend from the villain, voiced by James Hong who is once again typecast as the asian man who's trying to use a girl for a crazy ritual.

There's four weapons and four magic spells you can use. All of which level up quite quickly in the somewhat basic upgrade menu. What's a game without a tacked on upgrade system, mirite? It's not bad, but it has no fancy skill trees or anything.

The writing isn't the best, but it is entertaining. Especially the dialogue between Marlow and the floating Mayan mask he talks to. The voices are good in the sense that they're over the top and fit the style that the game is going for. 

The pacing is great. A nice mix of platforming, combat, puzzles, wall climbing, sliding, and on rail shooting. They're spread out to keep things interesing as you progress. The combat itself is also pretty good. It doesn't feel sloppy or cheap. Good PC hack and slash titles are few and far between and this is one that I'm glad I got to play.

It's totally worth a purchase and playthrough.

9693934.review:
A little gem of a game. Not too long probably around 6 hours if you rush it.

Combat is ok, doesnt have a great deal of depth but there are plenty of combo's to remember (or you can bash the shizzle out of your buttons). Platforming sections work well and there are secrets to find along the way.

Varied gameplay from hanging from a chopper dodging obstacles to a twin cobra esque top down chopper/plane shootin game.

Puzzles to solve although they are never taxing.

You can replay the minigames anytime from the main menu so you can try to beat yours or your freinds scores/times.

Absolutley OTT storyline and the amount of exploding barrels is comical, but still part of the fun.

There is a constant dialogue between you and your mask which some will like and others will hate, it was funny in parts.

All in all a fun game, as long as you dont take it too seriously. Sorta Guardian of light+Darksiders.

9668890.review:
Das Spiel schaut grafisch super aus. Das Gameplay ist absolut flüssig, der Soundtrack klasse und die Dialoge zwischen Marlow und der Maske die quasi sein Mentor ist sind erstklassig! Mal lustig, mal hilfreich, mal sarkastisch oder sie bringen die Story weiter. Die Story ist schnell erzählt: Marlow will seine Freundin retten, seinen eigenen Tot rächen und nebenbei die Welt retten. Drei Dinge auf einmal und alles mündet dann in einem spaßigen Endbosskampf. 
Ab und zu lockert das Spiel den Spieler mit kleineren Herausforderungen auf oder wir fliegen einen Hubschrauber oder später auch ein Flugzeug und das Spiel spielt sich dann wie ein Shoot'em Up auf dem Sega Megadrive Anfang der 1990er. Klasse!

Pro:
- tolle Grafik
- flüssiges Gameplay
- viel Action (z.B. relativ viele gescriptete Ereignisse)
- lustige Dialoge mit Marlows Sidekick
- lässt sich perfekt mit Maus und Tastatur spielen
- sympathischer Held und glaubwürdig fieser Bösewicht 
- faires Speichersystem + Speichern jederzeit möglich
- günstiger Preis

Kontra:
- Sprachausgabe nur auf Englisch (aber dafür gibt es einen deutschen Untertitel)
- Es hätten ein paar mehr Gegner Typen sein können
- nervige Quick-Time-Events 
- Kamera lässt sich nicht frei bewegen
 
Neutral:
- geringe Spieldauer von ca. 6 Stunden (je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad ggf. etwas höher)
Ich hab die Spieldauer mal unter dem Punkt "neutral" geschrieben. Zum einen kostet Marlow Briggs nicht viel, also das Preisleistungsverhältnis stimmt. Ich persönlich mag diese Mamut-Spiele die 40-50+ Stunden brauchen eher nicht, und freue mich daher wenn ich ein Spiel an 2-3 Tagen Abends durchspielen kann. 
Dennoch sehen das andere Spieler anders und würden das eher unter "Kontra" schreiben. Ich fand dass die 6 Stunden gut gefüllt waren und die Geschichte darin gut erzählt wurde. 

Meine Wertung: 7,5/10

9637438.review:
Zunächst das kurze, spoilerfreie Fazit:

Hübsche, wenn auch nicht perfekte, Grafik. Gutes und einfaches Gameplay. (Für viele bestimmt zu einfach!)
Leider hin und wieder bei Herausforderungen frustrierend. Kamera lässt sich nicht bewegen. Story zu klischeehaft.
Quicktimes sind nervig. Klingt zwar mies, aber alles in allem ein gutes Spiel!
Meine Empfehlung: Aktuell kostet es 2 €. Kaufen! (Bei 14 € wartet auf Sales. Wäre aber kein Weltuntergang wenn nicht.)

[ACHTUNG!]
[WEITERE REVIEW ENTHÄLT SPOILER!]

Meinung:
Ein gutes Spiel mit recht vielen Mängeln, die während des Spieles immer wieder auffallen.
Echt schade! Dennoch bin ich froh es gespielt zu haben. Schlecht ist es nämlich nicht.

Aussehen:
Die Grafik (Umwelt, Tiere usw.) ist grundsätzlich sehr hübsch. Animationen in Zwischensequenzen sieht man nur am Anfang und am Ende. Animationen im Kampf sehen gut aus. Mimik ist bis auf Lippenbewegung eigentlich nicht vorhanden. Blendeneffekt (In-Sonne-guck-Kreise) sind mies. Die Inszenierung ist (vor allem am Anfang) erstklassisch, actionhaft!

Endbosskämpfe und normale Gegner:
Die Kämpfe sind schnell vorbei und ziemlich einfach.
Manchmal erscheinen normale Gegner als Bossgegner da sie einzeln und in abgesperrten Arealen auftreten. Dies dient allerdings nur der Vorstellung dieser neuen Gegnertypen und deren Art zu kämpfen. 
An Gegnern gibt es:
Insekten und Menschen, sowie starke Riesenskorpione und später geisterartige Rabenmenschen.
Dann gibt es noch weitere Normale die seltener auftreten (starker Schwerttyp) und Untergruppen (Berserker : Mensch). 
Sowie einige Bosse (Höllenhund, Riese, Monster, Endboss etc.).

Gameplay:
Es gibt eine ausreichend große Anzahl an Kombos die man einfach einsetzen kann. Darauf kann man aber auch verzichten.
Linke Maustaste ist ein schneller, und Rechte ist ein starker Angriff. Die Kämpfe gestalten sich sehr einfach.
Dabei hilft auch der niedrige Schwierigkeitsgrad (jedenfalls auf normal).
Oft denkt man: "Ach du Schande! Wie soll ich das packen?" und eine Minute später schaut man verdutzt auf die Leiche des Gegners oder steht schon im nächsten Raum. 

Level:
Die Level gehen ohne Unterbrechungen (Zwischensequenzen nicht mitgezählt!) ineinander über.
Sie beinhalten Sprung-, und Kletterpassagen, einfachen Rätsel und Abschnitte in denen gekämpft wird. Ladezonen hab ich nie bemerkt! Gespeichert werden, kann übrigends jederzeit und überall.
(glaube ohne Ausnahme). Checkpoints sind mehr als fair.

Quicktime-Events:
Selten (nur in wenigen Bosskämpfen) trifft man auf einfache Quicktime-Events. Diese sagen einem plötzlich, dass man beispielsweise "P" drücken soll (P = Rechte Maustaste). Wenn man allerdings mit der Maus spielt (statt beide Hände auf der Tastatur), kann das schon ziemlich verwirren. Zum Glück sind sie aber sehr selten.

Kameraführung:
Es gibt keine manuelle Kamera! Das ist einer der größten Kritikpunkte für mich! 
Kamerafehler sind hier aber nicht das Problem!
Die automatische Kameraführung schleudert, in actionreichen Inszenierungen von Kämpfen auf herunterfallenden Felsbroken und dergleichen, unkontrolliert und übertrieben umher.
An manchen Stellen im Spiel, kommt man sich vor, als spiele man Bayonetta. ^^

Waffen und Zauber:
Es gibt vier Waffen und vier Zauber, die im Laufe der Story freigeschaltet werden. (Keine Optionalen)
Hier die Reihenfolge, und was sie so ungefähr machen:

[Kenne die echten Namen nicht, sry. ;) ]

W1 = Sense (Anfangswaffe)
Z1 = Kometenhagel (Verletzt Gegner um Spieler herum. Diese brennen dann.)
W2 = Dolche (Schnelle Waffe)
Z2 = Erdspieße (Verletzt Gegner vor² dem Spieler. Macht viel Schaden)
W3 = Peitsche (Riesige Reichweite!)
Z3 = Einfrieren (Friert Gegner ein. Wehrlos.)
W4 = Hammer/Axt (Größter Schaden. Kombos brechen Gegner-Angriffe ab!)
Z4 = Wirbelwind (Verletzt Gegner um Spieler herum.)

²das automatische Anvisieren nervt tierisch, da Mana nicht für zwei Zauber reicht.

Als letztes lernt man das gleiten!

Jede der Waffen und Zauber kann man im Menü upraden. Von Stufe 0 auf Stufe 3.
Nach Graf Zahl macht das vier Stufen pro Waffe und Zauber. Mit jedem Upgrade wächst die max. Mana oder max. HP und die Anzahl der Kombos.

Herausforderungen:
Das frustrierendste am Spiel sind mit Abstand die Herausforderungen.
Diese treten in regelmässigen Abständen auf. (Man kann sie danach auch aus dem Hauptmenü heraus starten).
Diese fordern je nach Hf. zwischen niedriger und hoher Reaktionszeit.
Außerdem sind sie das Einzige am Spiel (jedenfalls bei mir) was verbuggt war. Wenn zB. eine Herausforderung startet, endet sie die Sekunde darauf. Nach 3-4 mal neustarten (der Herausforderung, nicht des Spiels!) gings dann aber immer wieder.
Zum Glück dauern die Herausforderungen nie wirklich lange. Sie bringen aber auch ein wenig Abwechslung ins Spiel. ZB. in Form von Shoot ’em ups.

Story:
Die Story ist ziemlich einfach und mir ein wenig zu klischeehaft.
Hier eine kurze (nicht sonderlich präzise) Zusammenfassung:

Protagonist (Marlow Briggs) und seine Freundin (nennen wir sie... pff... Peach) gehen zu einem alten, asiatischen Geschäftsmann (öhm... Tang Ching), im Dschungel. Dieser ist der Boss von Peach. Der zwingt sie Texte in alten Ruinen zu lesen und lässt Marlow töten weil er schwarz ist. Nurn Scherz :D. Marlow hat nur seine Freundin vor einem miesen Umgangston schützen wollen. Statt, dass die Assistentin vom... Ching... Marlow erschießt, soll sie ihn mit der Sense, die da rum steht, töten. Das macht sie. Marlow stirbt. Marlow kommt wieder zurück. (Brütal Legend lässt grüßen :D)
Ab jetzt übernehmen wir den "sacred warrior". Und dabei werden wir das gesamte Spiel über von einer fliegenden Maske begleitet. (Irgendein alter Gott(?) der die Prohezeiung kennt).
(Diese sieht man im Gameplay aber nicht, keine Sorge. Also nicht wie diese in Crash Bandicoot.)

Wir suchen nun Peach die uns immer wieder Briefe hinterlässt, in denen sie uns verrät, was sie für den alten Tang entschlüsselt hat. Wir trefen auf Tangs Assistentin und jagen Sie. Diese hilft uns und wir suchen weiter nach Peach.
Peach erzählt (über Briefe) von brutalen und brutaleren Ritualen die an den Wänden stehen.
Tang folgt denen ohne zu zögern. Mit der Zeit wird klar, dass er ein Zauberer ist, der extremer Macht hinterherjagt.
(Und mit "mit der Zeit" meine ich, als er ein inselgroßes Stück Land wachsen lässt... über "Gestensteuerung".)
Es ist klar, dass wir ihn finden und töten, sowie Peach befreien müssen. Diese gibt die Hoffnung aber so langsam auf, und bittet Marlow sie im Stich zu lassen, sodass wenigstens er überlebt. 

Wie es weitergeht dürfte sich von selbst erklären. ;)

Logik:
Öfter mal hat das Spiel einige Logikfehler. Jeder von uns kennt sowas: "Ach komm, du kannst aus Hubschraubern springen ohne, dass dir etwas passiert, doch fällst du wo hin, wo du nicht hin darfst verreckst du?" oder "In den Zwischensequenzen und so killt der alle mit einem Schlag, doch im Gameplay stecken die Gegner mehr ein als 'n Pole." (nur Spaß^^)

9626104.review:
You expect nothing. Some b-movie styled budget slasher from some slovenian guys. Yeah, you've seen that shit, you know what to expect. Ten minutes into game. Can't stop. The game is fucking awesome. Holy shit it's end credits already... Why haven't I bought this game day one? Because no one told me it's that awesome. And even if someone had tried to I still wouldn't believe.
Seriously, don't be a dumb fuck like me - go buy the game. It's brilliant for it's budget, with enjoyable puns and good written dialogs and proper voice acting, 80's flicks inspired scenario, competent gameplay mechanics, colorful visuals and one of the best pacing in whole industry. Go get it.

9464416.review:
Really had fun with this game. I'd never heard of it before but after watching the trailer I decided that it looked enjoyable... and it was. It's your standard hack and slash action game, with multiple enemies and crushing combos but it's pretty well executed.
The game looks good, with varied and colourful locations, the fighting can get a bit repetitive in places but for the most part the gameplay is nice and varied.
One of the highlights is the tongue-in-cheek humour throughout the game. The game pokes fun at the genre stereotypes and the verbal "swordplay" between Marlow and the Mask of Death that accompanies you is often genuinely funny.

The game will take you about 8 hours to finish, which is long enough and ensures that the game doesn't become a chore to finish. I would recommend playing on Hard difficulty to have a bit of a challenge.

9410050.review:
Man schlüpft in die Rolle von Marlow Briggs, einem Feuerwehrmann, der seiner Frau / Freundin an einer Ausgrabungsstätte unter die Arme greifen möchte. Doch als sie sich weigerte, für ihren Boss eine antike Schriftrolle (o.ä.) zu übersetzen, lässt dieser Marlow mit einer Sense töten, um ihre Arbeitsmotivation zu steigern. Doch in der Sense schlummert ein uralter Geist, der Marlow als heiligen Krieger ansieht und ihn wieder zum Leben erweckt.

Ein Hack'n'Slay im Stil wie man es von Dante's Inferno, God of War oder Devil May Cry 4 kennt - nur nicht ganz so ausgebaut. Ansonsten einfache Bedienung, grafisch gut und schöne Effekte.

9316785.review: Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death, игра в жанре слэшер .  Сюжет выполнен в стиле боевиков B класса 90х годов.   В плане геймплея, игра представляет из себя, кальку с God of war и пхожих на него игр!   Честно, увидев в первый раз героя с косой , на ум сразу приходит  сравнение с Dantes inferno, а получив хлыст, и увидев как Марлоу им орудует , сразу вспоминаешь  Castlevania: Lords of shadow.  Вообще в игре 4 вида оружия, и столько же видов магии. Разнообразием врагов и их дизайном , игра то же  похвастаться не может, тут все как у всех.  На пути Марлоу, будут как и положено играм данного жанра, встречаться разнообразные боссы. Схватки с ними хоть и стандартные, но довольно яркие и динамичные. Конечно, придется и попрыгать, и головоломки порешать. Но головолмки здесь, еще легче чем в God of war)).  Боевая система здесь, точьно такая же как и в God of war, тут тоже не каких сюрпризов!  Графика в игре выглядит довольно прилично, хотя как мне кажеться  многим может не понравиться практически полное отсутствие настроек графики! Звук и музыка в игре на приличном уровне, не раздрожает, но и не запоминается. Вообще , в этом весь Marlow Briggs , он вторичен  во всем.  Пройдя игру до конца , я уверен что вы вспомните около 10 игр в которых, вы все это видили. Да что там говорить, в первой заставке сразу вспоминаешь Splatterhouse))!  И эта вторичность ее один из главных недостатков, но если  подумать то эту вторичность можно занести и в главные плюсы! Потому что неизвестно , что бы получилось если, разрабтчики начали бы придумывать что то свое))! А так получился наполненый экшеном, яркий , интересный слэшер. Да может игра вторична, но все чужие идеи задействованы толково, и  в целом образуют очень приятную картину.  Но рекоммендовать я бы ее всем и каждому бы не стал, так как за последнее  время, на pc вышло довольно большое количество, более стоящих слэшеров вроде: 2 частей Castlevania Lords of shadow, Metal gear rising  и DMC, а в мае подойдет Killer is dead. Но все равно, Marlow Briggs  достоин внимания!  Моя оценка    -7.5

9267747.review:
Il gioco che non ti aspetti. 
Sebbene in fin dei conti sia un clone di God of War e similia, la cura che gli sviluppatori hanno messo in questo titolo è sorprendente, nonostante in alcuni momenti tradisca la sua natura di "indie". La storia è banale (pur simpatica) ma è un pretesto per un turbinio di azione, trappole e  esplosioni in pieno stile b-movie che durerà per tutto il gioco, senza mai un momento di pausa per tirare il fiato. Il combat system è, nella sua classicità di genere, molto ben studiato, con una buona differenziazione tra i vari tipi di arma e delle combo appaganti e animate alla grande (una gioia usare e "sentire" la variante pesante, chi ha provato sa). Un po' deludente invece la varietà di nemici, anche se non mancheranno momenti particolarmente goduriosi contro alcuni boss e mid-boss. 
Graficamente c'è poco da eccepire: per essere una produzione a basso costo la production value è a livelli stellari, e alcuni livelli non sfigurano neanche se confrontati con alcuni giochi tripla A.
Menzione d'onore per il doppiaggio, veramente eccezzionale e azzeccato, sopratutto per quanto riguarda il nostro compagno maschera che più di una volta strapperà il sorriso con i suoi battibecchi con Marlow.  
Che dire, mi sono sentito non poco in colpa per averlo preso a prezzo scontatissimo ma ahimè, non ne avevo mai sentito parlare prima e ammetto di essermici imbattuto quasi "per caso", ed è un vero peccato che un gioco simile sia passato così in sordina.
Non fate il mio stesso errore, giocateci, godetevelo e passate parola.

9262091.review:
Yay, yet another action adventure on rails. Then again, at least it's not a puzzle platformer! Honestly though, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/249680/]Marlow Briggs[/url] isn't all that bad as long as you don't mind the linearity. 

I have to say I have absolutely no idea where Marlow Briggs comes from, whether it's a franchise of some sorts or simply a new IP. What I do know is that it features a badass-looking African-American main character full of buff and somewhat lacking in smarts. As it happens Mr. Briggs decided to drop in an visit his sweetheart at the dig site where she works, spend some quality holiday time together. As it also happens, his sweetheart works for an unscrupulous mafia boss hell-bent on becoming a god. What follows is a standard man rescues woman plot, though in this case it's filled with cheesy jokes and commentary from the characters as well as lots of over-the-top action and destruction. Think 90's action movies maybe - big unbelievable machines, lots of explosions, and an evil mastermind who just can't help commenting on the main character's progress (and his own failures).

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=197082945

In terms of game mechanics there isn't all that much here that hasn't been done before. Lots of running and jumping and avoiding various implements of death, a significant number of speed slaloming sections too. A few puzzles involving pressure-plates and levers too, though they're pretty easy to grasp and rather annoying to execute at times. A lot of those are also timer-based which only makes it more frustrating. Possibly to compensate for this there are a few turret sections and some top-down plane shmup sections too.

Combat is based on combos composed of light and heavy attack mixes, though I have to give credit to the ingame combo tutor. In more detail there are 4 weapons that cover the usual variety - a standard balanced weapon, a set of daggers with high speed but low attack, a whip with massive range and rate of attack but even lower attack, and a massive scythe that probably should've been a sledgehammer given its slow but devastating attack. On top of that there are 4 types of magic - Fire, Earth, Water, and Wind - and a quickfire homing magic missile. Creep-wise there are several standard varieties - including but not limited to shield-bearers, heavies, giants, gunners, or huge scorpions - sadly those feel more like a chore past the few initial encounters. Every now and then a boss comes along (5 times, to be precise) and things get more entertaining.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=193176104

Visually it's a decent offering, the models look plenty detailed and the environments are rich and vibrant. And I really mean this - initially there are massive excavation machines that resemble moving fortresses more than anything and later on lots of ruins and jungle and mountains. Maybe the textures don't hold up to AAA games upon closer inspection but overall there's nothing to complain about. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=226996285

Animation-wise there doesn't seem much to complain about, attacks look smooth and interrupts are more than an instant transition to a hit pose. Of particular note is the unusual style that some of the cutscenes are done it - stop-motion frames! It's kinda like what Batman: Arkham Asylum/City did - a series of snapshots of a 3D scene brimming with action an momentum. Hard to describe but pretty successful. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=192811453

Now on the audio side things are not as pretty though. There are a TON of dialogues and voiced chatter, and it's not the worst it could be. The main character actually sounds pretty decent, as does the main villain. However, I personally had issues and very few voice-overs actually played. If it wasn't for the subtitles I'd have no idea someone was talking. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=231662424

The only other big gripe I had with this title was the camera. I found the camera mighty awkward most of the time and there is no way to actually adjust the camera manually! This ties in into finding hidden bonuses and collectibles I suppose but those are few and far between to actually warrant that. And it's not like the camera actually follows behind at all times, nope, the angle seems to be pre-defined in most zones/areas/corridors.


Initially I wasn't sure I'd stick through to the end. I've seen [url=www.youtube.com/watch?v=6zg9NHjHC-c]TotalBiscuit's WTF Is..[/url] on Marlow Briggs and got hooked. Then I fired it up and noticed the missing voice-overs. And this somewhat killed the mood for me. With the voice overs (and given their frequency) the game would've been pretty engaging, as it was it turned into a rather mundane experience. [b]Nevertheless, Marlow Briggs is a decent enough action adventure - as long as you're not expecting too much.[/b] Darksiders or DmC this is not, after all.

9052809.review:
In ultimele zile am reusit sa pun mana pe un joc care m-a atras, mai mult din curiozitate, in ultimele saptamani, cand am vazut niste filmulete de prezentare pe Youtube. Este vorba despre Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death, un joc de actiune hack and slash, 3rd person in stilul God of War, sau Darksiders 2, produs de ZootFly si distribuit de 505 Games. Imaginile din prezentare aratau bine, dar un lucru mi-a dat de gandit, pretul scazut al jocului, de 14 euro, mult sub media acestor tipuri de jocuri. Impresia de la inceput a fost ca e un joc slabut, dupa intro, dar cum a inceput gameplay-ul mi-am schimbat opinia. Este un joc extraordinar, face toti banii, chiar si mai mult si inca ma tine conectat.

Povestea

Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death este ca un film de actiune, povestea este asemanatoare cu productii cinematografice de categoria B, filme ce au in centru actori precum Jason Statham sau Silvester Stallone. Marlow Briggs, personajul principal, este un pompier musculos ajuns in America Centrala intr-o vizita la iubita lui, cercetatoare arheologica. Cei doi au parte de doar cateva minute impreuna, caci seful sitului, un psihopat avid de putere, o forteaza pe domnisoara sa lucreze in gasire unor artefacte care ar trebui sa-i confere puteri magice. Pana acum totul este clasic filmului de actiune, insa actiunea ia o intorsatura spre fantastic cand Marlow este ucis cu o arma descoperita in sit, fapt care trezeste la viata Mask of Death (Masca Mortii), un spirit razboinic, care il reinvie pe Briggs, anuntandu-l ca el este “cel ales” si-i confera puteri supraomenesti. Eroul nostru pleaca in cautarea iubitei, distrugand totul in cale si invatand abilitati noi cu fiecare misiune indeplinita. Totul pare un cliseu pana acum, dar cei de la ZootFly au reusit sa salveze povestea prin intruchiparea intr-un mod plin de umor a personajelor. Marlow are replici haioase in legatura cu tot ce se intampla, un umor simplu si bun si auto-critica. Masca, care il urmeaza peste tot este un fel de Jim Carrey, fiind foarte vorbareata si plina de replici taioase, ca deh, n-a mai vorbit cu nimeni de 2000 de ani si se plictisea.

Gameplay

Avand in vedere ca Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death este un joc de actiune hack and slash trebuie sa ne asteptam sa avem la dispozitie o multime de taste menite sa execute multe miscari si scheme de actiune. Asa este, dar totul este intuitiv. Eu am jucat si pe tastatura si am testat si controllerul, pentru ca este disponibil in joc. De pe PC este relativ simplu, poti folosi doar tastatura sau combinatie tastatura + mouse, eu am ales ce-a de-a doua varianta, iar tastele de care am avut nevoie au fost WASD + E, F si SPACE si numerele cand schimbi armele, iar din mouse am executat schemele de bataie, folosiind click stanga si dreapta pentru atac direct si alternativ si click pe scroll pentru un atac cu un fel de energie, la distanta. Unele scheme necesita apasarea repetata si de 5 ori a aceleiasi taste, dar totul merge de la sine si daca apesi la nimereala. Cu controllerul e si mai simplu, tastele sunt mapate clasic si jocul ii foloseste toate functiile, ceea ce e extraordinar.

Avem de-a face cu un joc de actiune/aventura 3rd person, in care nu poti controla camera. Exista momente cand camera nu este centrata cum trebuie si scapi din vedere personajul care poate pica in prapastie sau se bate in afara campului vizual. Nu m-a deranjat prea tare acest lucru, caci de fiecare data cand mori, Masca are cate o replica taioasa, punandu-ti sub semnul intrebari abilitatile, razand de tine cand mori, avand o remarca sarcastica despre ce doreai sa faci sau despre masculinitatea ta, ca si personaj.

De-a lungul jocului va trebui sa combini abilitati de lupta cu dexteritate in evitarea obstacolelor sau acuratetea unor sarituri de pe o platforma pe alta. Actiunea se petrece intr-un ritm extrem de alert, ceea ce m-a atras. Inamicii sunt de putine feluri, insa vin di nce in ce mai multi si nu te plictisesti. In plus, in fiecare parte a jocului vei primi anumite misiuni speciale care te vor face sa incerci de mai multe ori aceasi misiune pana iti iese cum trebuie. Sunt si momente cand trebuie sa iti folosesti inteligenta ca sa rezolvi anumite puzzle-uri si sa scapi din situatii dificile.

Printre adversari se numara muncitori si luptatori de gherila, apoi animale fantastice sau oameni posedati de spirite malefice, in functie de zona in care esti. Ce mi-a placut in timpul luptelor este faptul ca poti folosi aproape tot ce ai in jur, butoaie, cutii si explozibil, dar si mediul inconjurator. De exemplu, pe platforme poti inhata inamicii si sa-i arunci de pe margine, scapand astfel rapid de ei. De asemenea, arma cu care esti echipat are abilitatea de a bara/respinge atacuri, iar atunci cand esti atacat cu rachete, le poti bara si chiar crea un ricoseu, intorcand-o asupra atacatorului. In anumite locuri din jungla te vei trezi atacat de paianjeni sau scorpioni, mai mici la inceput, dar chiar si de dimensiuni mari, iar o abilitate care mi-a placut a fost ca, atunci cand reusesti o combinatie de lovituri asupra animalelor mari si le ametesti, poti folosi tasta E pentru a te urca pe aceasta si a o folosi in lupta.

Eu am jucat Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death direct pe nivelul dificil, lucru intelept si va recomand sa faceti la fel. Nu este imposibil de jucat astfel si vei beneficia de toate elementele posibile, oferindu-ti 8-10 ore de gameplay extrem de rapid si antrenant, lucru rar intalnit la jocurile single-player de acum, ceea ce il face si mai atractiv. Problema cu astfel de titluri este ca odata ce l-ai terminat e putin probabil sa-l rejoci, trebuind sa faci aceleasi lucruri din nou.

Grafica si sunet

Cum am spus la inceputul articolului, video-ul de la inceput te induce in eroare, fiind de slaba calitate, insa jocul arata foarte bine. Grafica este surprinzator de buna, in lupta mediul nu devine haotic si esti constient de ceea ce se intampla in jurul tau fara probleme. Schemele executate sunt la viteza normala, dar se observa usor chiar si inamicii aruncati in sus si care pot fi loviti chiar si in aer. In lupta ai posibilitatea sa executi o lovitura mortala, iar acestea sunt derulate in slow motion, din nou placute la vedere, in stilul Assassin’s Creed. O chestie care nu mi-a placut prea mult a fost in 3-4 momente ale jocului, cand am terminat o bataie cu un “boss”, atunci cand executi fatalitatea, imaginea se opreste, oferindu-ti cadre statice, vazute din mai multe unghiuri, un super slow-motion, care parca este mult prea incet, aproape ca in poze. Nu arata rau, sa nu ma intelegeti gresit, dar parca nu se imbina bine cu actiunea rapida de care ai parte in 99% din joc.

Sunetul nu m-a impresionat prea mult la prima incercare, dar cand am incercat jocul pe controller, conectat la televizor, pe Steam, totul s-a schimbat. Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death profita la maxim de capacitatile 7.1 ale sistemului de sunet si iti da impresia de film. Dialogurile sunt bune, pline de umor, dar pot deveni repetitive in unele momente. Sunetul de fundal este excelent, nu te disturba in joc, ceea ce m-a surprins in mod placut.

Concluzie

Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death este un joc surprinzator de bun, iar, avand in vedere pretul scazut, este in acest moment un best-buy pentru nisa actiune-aventura. Nu am vazut de mult un titlu asa de ieftin care sa ma tina conectat mai mult decat un joc prezentat ca un AAA, dar care dezamageste din multe puncte de vedere, spre deosebire de titlul dezvoltat de catre ZootFly. Gameplay-ul mi-a oferit aproape 10 ore de actiune intensa, extraordinara, lucru rar intalnit in aceste zile. Pot spune cu mana pe inima ca Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death este poate cel mai bun joc pe care l-am testat in ultima perioada, m-a surprins in multe aspecte si il recomandam cu placere.

9037524.review:
Despite looking like a Playstation 2 game, plus the added fact that there a lot more games out there that does everything Marlow Briggs does, but better . (The platforming is good, not great. The fighting is good, not great. The shooting parts are good, not great) it does have one giant thing going for it.

It is a hell of a lot of fun to play.

The game is not too hard, it definetely does not take itself seriously, and it is (as I said) a blast to play. About 8 hours long and the game varies itself just enough to keep things from getting too stale (you fight, but then you will platform for a bit, before doing more fighting and then maybe a little shooting) you could do a lot worse than to give Marlow Briggs a whirl.

9010187.review:
This game is pretty kickass.

Don't dismiss this as a paltry God of War clone. It's a pretty good, bombastic, blacksploitation version of God of War for PC. If you've played God of War (or Dantes Inferno for that matter), you'll know the score here. Constantly dancing dealing death with bright weapon trails between simple platforming and puzzle sections.

What's great about this game is the standard it sets. For such a small game, it really tries to stand out next to the AAA titles it mimics. The plot is a rather generic, tale of afterlife, revenge and rescuing a damsel in distress. The whole game uses voodoo and industrialism as it's theme, much like God of War uses greek mythology and the Underworld.

The graphics are pretty spectacular for such a short and budget developed game, with some excellent framed vistas which can be compared to the Uncharted series, the soundtrack can sometimes be repetitve and tiresome but the game is complimented by funny banter between Marlow and the titular Mask of Death, heckling Marlow's 'tough guy' one liners, in a sense, a buddy movie dynamic and not to far away from what the reboot of Shadow Warrior does. The game is full of Hollywood typical explosion visuals and solid sound effects.

Occasionally, the game takes you by surprise and ejects you into a minigame of a race collecting orbs, sliding down pathways avoiding obstacles, or a magnificently over the top on rails shooting section shooting helicopters down from the back of a moving vehicle and finally a top down arcade shooter much like Capcom's 1942 series, which is a pleasant diversion,

The game took me eight hours to beat in total and if experienced to the hack and slash format, platforming and puzzles that GoW delivers, you'll find no problems getting through the game. Much like GoW acquired weapons and abilities can be upgraded, but the selection is very, very limited and it's incredibly easy to upgrade the weapons using collectable orbs.

The controls are pretty solid and translated for mouse and keyboard, much like Blades of Time, (another PC hack and slash game), my only issue is using magic abilities using the complicated layout of holding down left control and a numberic key 1-4, which can make fights difficult if you want to attempt to use a magic move to wear enemies down. The boss fights are nothing spectacular and are just more or less obstacles from one section or another or purely acquiring a new ability. There is also no opportunity of back tracking in this game whatsoever and for that matter, nothing to backtrack for.

Even the credits are a bit of fun, you can tell the developers had a lot of fun making this title and it's totally worth a blast for a quick action/adventure/hack and slash title if you want to give it 6-8 hours. You might find yourself pleasantly surprised.

8928574.review: Although this game has some frustrating bugs (falling through the map mainly) it has heart and I'm eager to see what else this studio can come up with. Don't be put off by the opening scenes where it can be confusing as to what is happening.

Ugh. Or maybe force the audience to clap for the previews/trailers..Fuck QTE's.

8909133.review:
Every once and a while there comes a game so revolutionary, so full of ambition and creativity and with such flawless execution that they forever change the medium and shape it for years to come. They are the games that we remember decades after their release, and that continue to be cited as inspiration for new games long since we first revered at their brilliance. And then we have Marlow Briggs.

[i]Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death[/i] is not a revolutionary game; it does little if anything unique borrowing heavily from games of yore without ever outdoing them in its own right. It's not the most polish, it's production values are noticeably low, and has some truly aggravating design decisions. But none of this matters because despite being formulaic and shallow Marlow Briggs is unquestionably a blast to play. If ever there was such a thing as a B-game this is it, and what ridiculous amounts of fun it is.

As the curtain rises we find Marlow Briggs, aka "the man with large hands", arriving to visit his archaeologist girlfriend on a digsite she has been working at lately. Unfortunately, as is usually the case, the operation is in fact being run by a maniacal psychopath possessing godlike magic powers and an army of mercenaries to back him up. Marlow doesn't like this, but before he can take three step towards the door he's sent on a one way trip to Xibalba and his girlfriend kidnapped. Cue flashing lightning and a talking mask and Marlow is reborn as the sacred warrior, hero of prophecy destined to save the sacred land that has been disturbed by the militias presence.

 It should be noted that all of this plays out in the span of about 60 seconds, at which point you are tossed straight into the action. This isn't a game that takes itself seriously; not remotely. The plot is absolutely absurd and the dialog cheesy beyond compare, but Marlow succeeds because it knows it's silly and revels in being as self-aware and goofy as possible as it jumps from setpiece to setpiece with little regard to exposition or the mounting continuity errors. This is a game that wants you to laugh with it not at it, with excellent (for what it is) writing and spot on delivery that made it impossible for me not to enjoy myself, grinning the whole way through.

When Marlow and the Mask aren't cracking jokes they're smashing in skulls. It's impossible to ignore so to put it bluntly: this is a God of War clone. Right down to the distinctive way you open chests- er, collect skulls, it plays identically to [i]Sony Santa Monica's[/i] lovechild but that really isn't a bad thing. While it isn't as refined as that series, this is a comparable action game with some highly satisfying combat and impressive bossfights. It's nothing new, but it works well for the game and more than solid, with my only complaint being a large amount of overpowered enemies and occasionally getting locked into an animation.

Mixed together with the melee arena combat are a plethora of action movie moments such as shooting down helicopters with a mounted turret, and some light platforming and puzzle elements. The variety is great and helped alleviate much of the monotony that otherwise would have occurred from a strictly combat focus through the 6-7 hour campaign. 

While it won't win any graphics awards, this is actually a rather decent looking title. The environments in particular have a lot of detail put into them, and when the camera pans out for a vista it's a gorgeous site. For a budget title it's pretty impressive, but what I thought was most clever was how instead of using costly animation for the cutscenes, the majority are instead done as freeze frame 3D stills that the camera then slowly sifts through, using dynamic angles and purposely placed obstructions to allow for the scene without you actually seeing them do it. It's a neat idea and I have to applaud the developers for their ingenuity, even if it's a little jarring at times.

I'm not sure how many more ways I can say it at this point; [i]Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death[/i] is plain uncomplicated fun. In the same way a dumb summer blockbuster is enjoyable, Marlow doesn't need to be original or perfectly polished to be entertaining. It's a nonsensical adventure that I think almost anyone could enjoy if they can give it a chance, and quite frankly is some of the most [i]fun[/i] I've had with any video game in a long time.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2014/01/30/marlow-briggs-and-the-mask-of-death-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

8854368.review:
Достойная игра! Прежде всего хочется сказать, что раньше я о ней ничего не слышал, своего рода "тёмная лошадка". Но случайно наткнулся на неё в своей библиотеке и решил опробовать это чудо. После прохождения игры остался доволен. Marlow Briggs представляет из себя прежде всего слэшер с элементами не сложных головоломок. Если вы играли в God of War, то найдете много сходств с ней. Интересные видео-вставки в игре с фризами и слоумошенами, довольно неплохо. Главному герою по мере прохождения будут доступны 4 вида оружия и 4 вида магии, которые можно прокачивать. Иногда будут встречаться мини-игры с наградами. К примеру, подбить все вертолеты из пушки. Вы будете путешествовать вместе с "маской", которая в вас всилилась, в этом плане она очень похожа на Shadow Warrior.
В конце игры, когда начинаются титры, можно сыграть в мини-игру. Довольно интересный ход от разработчиков. Ведь 99% игроков не смотрят титры вообще.
Если любите хорошие слэшеры, то не проходите мимо и опробуйте.

8795249.review: Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death (MBATMOD) is a very fine, small Hack-and-Slay action adventure in the likes of God of War and Devil May Cry. It resembles God of War in many ways, you got 4 different weapons, each unlocked at a certain point in the story, 4 different kinds of magic (which aren't that balanced..), and orb-like collectables to upgrade your magic and weapons. it got a very good combo training system. nice visuals for a small title, at certain points it can easily be compared with AAA-titles. but over all that you got the worst screen-tearing! real xbox360 feeling ;) but it doesn't get in the way of the fun you can have with this title. grab it for a discount price and it's a steal! I got around 5hours gameplay on medium. ah, and the difficulty level likes to spike sometimes..so, now go and buy it already. cheers!

8786895.review:
Nettes Hack & Slay Spiel - Grafik und Sound sind okay
Am besten mit Gamepad spielbar.

Mann sollte aber nichts gegen Hüpfeinlagen und QTE Events haben die hat das Spiel sehr viel

Marlow Briggs ist von den Toten zurückgekehrt und von einen alten Maya Gott bessesen der mit ihm spricht. Die Dialoge zwischen den beiden sind witzig gemacht und er hat immer einen bissigen Kommentar wenn man stirbt.

Während des Spiels schaltet man diverse Waffen und Magiecombos frei die man noch updaten kann.

Das Spiel hat Speicherpunkte kein freies speichern was bei den Hüpfeinlagen manchmal nervig ist.

Es explodiert in dem Spiel soviel das man denkt da muss Michael Bay was mit zu tuen haben.

Die Rumble Funktion beim Gamepad ist im Menü nicht ausschaltbar da man ständig auf die Fresse bekommt kanns bissel auf die Dauer stören.

Um sie manuell zu deaktivieren geht man in den Steam Ordner von Marlow Briggs und und geht in den Unterordner "data" und sucht dort die "autoexec.xcom" die öffnet man mit dem Notepad von Win und sucht nach folgender Zeile: "set input.vibration.maxtime 300" hier ändert man die Zahl auf 0 und es ist deaktiviert.

Das Spiel selbst kostet 14 Euro aber ist beim letzten Sale für 3 bis 4 Euro im Angebot gewesen und da kann man ohne Probleme zuschlagen zu dem Preis. Alternativ schaut man nach anderen Anbietern

8759679.review:
Слэшер про рукастого негра.

Вашего ГГ убивают сразу (прямо в ролике), однако все не так просто. Цель вашего героя была благая - остановить осквернение бывших ацтекских земель корпорацией зла. И вот тут наш мертвый становится живее и сильнее всех живых, спасибо древней тотемной маске. Игра предоставит вам постоянный экшн и множество врагов, благо ассортимент оружия здесь приличный (ещё комбо с прокачкой есть). Помимо основных слэшерных элементов есть ещё простенькие головоломки, дабы разбавить градус безумия вокруг. В игре вы постоянно находитесь в движении, минутки покоя здесь точно не найти, прямо с первой секунды вас хватают за шкирку и не отпускают до самого конца. Графически для слэшера все выглядит довольно сочно и вкусно, анимация неплоха. 

Послушай маску! 6,5 из 10 :)

8728219.review: Un "God of war" in versione budget.... detto così non sembra niente di chè ma lasciateli una possibilità. Il risultato è un vortice frenetico di situazioni che ti porta sempre di piu' voler vedere cosa c'è dopo una boss fight o una discesa a rotta di collo o un voletto in elicottero - si c'è anche quello!! Tecnicamente si basa sull'Unreal engine che garantisce un impatto visivo gradevole. In sostanza si tratta di un titolo che ha solo una pretesa ... quella di far divertire il giocatore e in questo ci riesce.... e non mi sembra poco!!
